captions.text: [Commentator] Holy crap, did you see that?

My name's Travis Pastrana, 
this is my wife.
This is where I am going.
[My team]
And this is my story.
[On Pace with Pastrana, Season 2]
[Roush Fenway Racing]
[Travis] Roush Fenway Racing.

This right here is the "Nationwide 
Apartment", it also has a gym.

Coming into this NASCAR season, 
I am the, physically, healthiest I've been.

And the most out of shape
I've ever been in my entire life.

So we're starting from 
actual zero here.
You're in charge of this place.

Yes, we have a lot of fun up here, 
but we also work hard.

I think we've got a little 
something to work with here so--

We've got a lot of broken
to work with but we'll get there--

Humpty Dumpty, hey we can fix Humpty
Dumpty, you know what I'm saying?
♪ [old school hip hop instrumental] ♪

[Rodney Fetters, Pit Crew Coach]
Banners, that's the goal.
Banners!
Banners.
We need banners!
Lots of them.
Alright, and a mural.
[Rodney] And a mural.
One day there's going to be a mural.

The Daytona 500, Every racer
wants to win that.
♪ [old school hip hop instrumental] ♪
I'm here at pit practice day at Roush,
and my car is still getting the seat

and everything fitted because I'm 
a little taller than the other guys.
But jumping into Ricky's cup car.

They want you to be going 90mph
by the time you reach your pit stop,
and to be able to lock it down,

stopping exactly on the spot
you're supposed to stop.

The closer you are to 
where their board is,

the absolute faster the 
guys can get to the car.
♪ [electronic music] ♪

[Chad Norris Crew Chief] When I 
heard that Travis Pastrana
was coming to Roush Fenway,

I was really excited to be a 
part of this program,

he wants to be the 
best there is at it.

Like he has been at 
everything else he's done.

We've just got to be able
to work together

get on the same page and 
get our language together,

so we can make sure our cars are 
the best that they can be for race time.

[Chad] So Travis called Jack,
and really tried to set in stone,

about what he wanted to do here, 
they've come to an agreement

about how serious Travis really was,
about winning races.

[Jack] Roush Fenway Racing has been 
around for over 40 years.

We have managed to bring
forward the careers

of a lot of very successful,
very well known drivers.

[Jack Roush, Founder of
Roush Fenway Racing]

I think, in all, there have been 
17 drivers that have won in races.

Well I was really honoured when 
Travis reached out to us

and asked us if we would consider
running a Nationwide car.

Travis has been 
successful in so many

different forms of motor sport, 
and sports entertainment.

Stock car racing, and in particular
Nationwide racing,

is extremely competitive. It is
at least as competitive
as anything that Travis has ever done.
[announcer] Travis Pastrana!
[applause]

Such an honor to be on this team, 
and to be with these guys,

and definitely, we've had some 
success in other things,

but it doesn't mean anything
coming over here,

and definitely, I hope to live up 
to these expectations.
[On Pace with Pastrana]

[Nashville Superspeedway
Nashville, Tennessee]
♪ [trip hop] ♪

[Travis] Just about to start the season.
First day test with Roush Racing.

I'm not even in the same area code
right now, as I need to be.
Trevor goes, "try letting off the brake."

[Trevor Rayne
Nascar Driver]

Well you know, brakes are 
made to slow you down so,

when we were getting roaming charges
for calling you back there,

I thought you had to do something 
to speed up a little bit.
Thanks, I appreciate it!

But you're good man, 
you've picked up a lot.

[Travis] Trevor has been really awesome
to share a lot of his information,

then to come out here with me to actually
show me physically, to get schooled here.

You can just roll this
really light brake,

and then if you need to slow
down more, you can.

But this is where you need to be slowed
down by, it's here, not back there.

[Travis] Use less brake, turn the wheel
when you want to turn.
- Easy as that.
- Piece of cake.

[Travis] Out here, just
got done the first test,
immensely physically exhausted,

but had so much fun. 
Learned a lot.

[Travis] We're making a statement,
we're coming up, our car is loud,
our team is loud.

And I'm ready for it man. We've got
Daytona starting next week,

and if we don't do well, 
we're going to look like idiots.

We've got to come out here and do well,
and you know what, by the end of this year
we're going to figure it out.

[Daytona 500
Daytona, Florida]
♪ [hard rock] ♪

I got my first motorcycle win here, 
in Supercross at Daytona.

I raced my first 24 hour race
here at the Daytona 24 hour,

and to be a part of it 
is pretty damn cool.
♪ [hip hop instrumental] ♪

I'm still so nervous because 
we got the race coming up

and everything is about drafting, 
it's about who you're teaming up with,

it's about partnerships. And then I've got
to learn on the fly how to race.
♪ [epic hip hop instrumental] ♪
[Lap 1]
♪ [epic hip hop instrumental] ♪
[racecars zooming]
Go, go, go, go, go!
♪ [epic hip hop instrumental] ♪
[radio chatter]
[racecars zooming]
[Final lap]
♪ [epic hip hop instrumental] ♪
[cheering]
♪ [epic hip hop instrumental] ♪
[rumbling]
[racecars zooming]
[Commentator] Did you see that?

That is one high speed chaotic 
crash fest right there.

Make sure you've got oil pressure
if you're going to drive it.
[cheering]
Ten Four!
Good job today guys, good job.
♪ [soul music] ♪

Alright, this is one of my goals 
accomplished, top ten.
You ran every lap.

[Travis] Top ten, ran every lap.
Kind of crashed.

We went right up to the front, 
and then all of a sudden

Anett and Dillon got tangled, 
they took out Kasey Kahne

who was right behind me. 
They hit the wall so fast

like I've never seen. They were on my left
then they were in the wall and gone.
♪ [classic rock outro] ♪
See ya!
♪ [classic rock outro] ♪

[Travis] On the next episode of 
On Pace with Pastrana

I get back on a dirt bike, and
hang out with the DC crew
on McGrath's ranch.

title: On Pace w/ Pastrana - Racing at Daytona - S02E03

comments.text:
Ovals then. I never once doubted the skill of the drivers, only the way 
they are using those skills. I am sure they are better drivers than I, it 
is their job right? The reason nascar racing is done on an oval is to fit 
the maximum number of spectators in one place, and increase profits by 
doing so. Nascar is a sport driven by money, thats it.
